title: d3.transform fixes.
body:
This fixes various corner cases involving negative and zero scales, as well as proper support for skewX, which previously wasn't being computed correctly.

Includes browser-based tests!

Admittedly they could be a lot nicer e.g. animated D3-based progress bar and setTimeout to avoid browser lockup, but they did their job. :)

title: Fix d3.transform for scale(1,-1) and scale(-1,1).
body:
Fixes #377.

Can't add tests yet as JSDOM has no SVGMatrix implementation. :(

title: Script to build html index
body:
Mike,

I found it helpful to throw a quick script together to build an index page containing links to all of the examples.

Please pull if you think it might be useful for others.

Best wishes,

Alex

title: Origin support for drag behavior.
body: This obviates the need to maintain an origin externally (such as this.**origin**).

title: Update JSDOM and Vows versions (Node.js v0.6.x compatibility).
body:
This required changing assert.length to assert.lengthOf in tests, due to a Vows.js change to be compatible with Node.js v0.6.x.  [Further details](https://github.com/cloudhead/vows/pull/141).

Hence this also makes the D3.js test suite fully compatible with Node.js v0.6.x.

title: Dispatch "dragstart" on mousemove.
body:
Previously this was being dispatched on mousedown, which doesn't necessary indicate a drag gesture has started (it might be a stationary click).

Also, call event.preventDefault() on mousedown (to prevent default behaviours like text selection).

This is backwards-incompatible if you relied on d3.event.{dx,dy} being zero on dragstart, but I doubt anyone would have relied on that.

title: Make axes reorderable in parallel coords example.
body: Transitioning all these paths is a bit slow, perhaps we should just have the axes titles draggable on their own.

title: Fix minor bug in exponent notation interpolation.
body: It wasn't matching `xe+y` correctly.

title: Use single loop for d3.extent.
body: I was tempted to just make d3.min and d3.max use d3.extent internally, to avoid having to write extra tests. :)

title: Remove stray global in brush example.
Hi! I cleaned up your code for you!
body:
Hi there!

This is WhitespaceBot. I'm an [open-source](https://github.com/Gunio/WhitespaceBot) robot that removes trailing white space in your code, and gives you a gitignore file if you didn't have one!  

Why whitespace? Whitespace is an eyesore for developers who use text editors with dark themes. It's not  a huge deal, but it's a bit annoying if you use Vim in a terminal. Really, I'm just a proof of  concept - GitHub's V3 API allows robots to automatically improve open source projects, and that's really cool. Hopefully, somebody, maybe you!, will fork me and make me even more useful. My owner is [funding a bounty](http://gun.io/open/12/add-security-flaw-fixing-features-to-whitespacebot) to anybody who can add security fixing features to me. 

I've only cleaned your most popular project, and I've added you to a list of users not to contact again, so you won't get any more pull requests from me unless you ask. If I'm misbehaving, please email my owner and tell him to turn me off! If this is pull request is of no use to you, please just ignore it.

Thanks!
WhiteSpacebot from [Gun.io](http://gun.io).

title: Allow event.changedTouches to be used instead of event.touches.
body: This is because the "touchend" event removes the touch from event.touches on iOS, but it can still be accessed via event.changedTouches.

title: Fix typo.
Configurable extents for d3.behavior.zoom.
body:
This is my take on the matter. I'm open to suggestions for API improvements!

I believe this also fixes #341 as the domain is no longer stashed in the scale, although I haven't tested modifying the scale domain elsewhere.

See also: #247.

title: Tiny prettification of the calendar examples
body: Non-data dates were previously showed as "NaN%" and "undefined" respectively. This is the local fix approach. Another might be letting d3.format grow some handling for undefined, null or NaN values, say, d3.format(".01%", undefined, "N/A"); for giving a fallback for illegal input.

title: Update UglifyJS, JSDOM and Vows.
body:
I ran the tests on the newly minified files too, for good measure, and everything passed.

You'll need to run `npm update` in the `d3` directory to update `./node_modules/`.

title: Better handling of empty domains for nice scales.
body: This addresses #337.

title: Add tests for d3.geom.polygon and fix centroid bug.
body:
d3.geom.polygon(…).area() assumes screen pixel coordinates with (0, 0) at the top left, and y increasing going downwards.  This results in a positive area for counterclockwise coordinates.  Howver, the default centroid calculation was assuming "usual" Cartesian coordinates with y increasing going upwards, hence the centroid coordinates were incorrectly multiplied by -1.

This fix won't affect d3.geo.path(…).centroid() as it passes a constant to d3.geom.centroid.

This includes a _really_ simple test, I'm sure we can flesh these out as time goes on. :)

Also, I wasn't sure if polygon coordinates should end at the start point or not, so I've tested both for now.

title: Fix tests in Linux.
body:
The directory listing order is different from OS X and so the tests are run in a slightly different order.  Other tests were leaving data bound to the "body" element, and this data was then propagated when new elements were appended, and thus messed up the data propagation test.

You can probably leave out the `html("")` changes as they were a red herring, but I don't think they do any harm.  Maybe we need a reusable "setup" function that clears the body element of any data and elements.

title: Add d3.mean.
body:
Uses Welford's algorithm to avoid overflow.

See #245.

title: Fix transitioning styles to null (removal).
body: This prevents styles being set to the string `"null"`, which causes a fatal error in IE9 due to being an invalid CSS style in most cases.

title: add geotranslate method to projections and tests
body:
Geotranslate works like translate but takes projection coordinates as input. It
is also scale independent, i.e. there is no need to adjust geotranslate after
changing the scale. The primary use of this function is to move the map to a
specific place.

Unfortunately this introduces some repeated code to maintain the translation internally independent of the scale. I didn't find a good way of avoiding this though and would be grateful for any pointers.

title: make Makefile GNU make v3.82 compatible
body:
Quote from NEWS file:

In previous versions of make it was acceptable to list one or more explicit
targets followed by one or more pattern targets in the same rule and it
worked "as expected". However, this was not documented as acceptable and if
you listed any explicit targets AFTER the pattern targets, the entire rule
would be mis-parsed. This release removes this ability completely: make
will generate an error message if you mix explicit and pattern targets in
the same rule.

title: fix bug that causes chord layout to break in Opera
body:
The chord layout uses an assigment like x += y to specify the end angle of a
chord segment. This seems to return the new value in most browsers, but the old
value (i.e. x - y) in Opera.

title: allow to specify custom tick positions
body:
Custom positions for ticks can be specified like
ticks([1, 20, 33, 56])
which will give ticks in those positions.

title: Add test for transition.selectAll and NodeLists.
body: This tests the fix in cd3d236015cc2206186b359227f54c4fc761a648.

title: Another test for empty children arrays.
body: This tests for the issue fixed in 6804a60fe4899fa83586bad51b45ad94ef215203.

title: Support space-separated classes in classed operator.
body: Fixes #320.

title: shp2GeoJSON
body:
Hey Mike,

First time I am using Github, so I am not so sure about the way to send a pull request properly. A year ago, Vadim Ogievetsky gave me some of his python files to turn shp files into json ones. I have just slightly modified the code so that we can do the same thing with GeoJSON for d3.

I asked Vadim a while ago if I could share his files and he was ok with it. Feel free to ignore this request, if you think it's irrelevant but I thought it might help some people around. 

Bixente

title: Cylindrical projections.
body: My name is Jason and I'm addicted to map projections.
